newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil shares end firm, Petrobras jumps.
newsitem.headline: Brazil shares end firm, Petrobras jumps.

text.p: Brazilian shares ended strong on continued foreign buying, with state oil firm Petrobras spearheading the rise, brokers said.
The Bovespa index of the 49 most active shares closed up 2.1 percent at 78,163 points.
Trade remained heavy, with the bolsa's turnover totalling 599.6 million reais ($576.5 million).
Some traders said they were surprised with the market's strength throughout the session as the bolsa resisted an expected profit-taking after consecutive days of rises.

Petrobras PETp.SA jumped 4.02 percent to 194 reais on news that Brazil may allow foreigners to buy a minority voting stake in the company when Congress approves legislation regarding the opening up of the sector to private capital.
"We had expected some selling pressure but the market absorbed all profit-taking," one trader said.

Traders also said foreign investment should be behind the market's rally because, despite optimism that the re-election amendment will pass Congress, market players are not that sure President Fernando Henrique Cardoso will succeed in having the issue approved in lower house floor next week.
State power utility Eletrobras closed up 2.66 percent at 424 reais.
Benchmark Telebras rose 2.4 percent, ending at 89.50 reais.
Analysts also said shares are seen firming next week although the market may see some gains-taking as the bolsa failed to weaken as expected.
